Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Milton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
COMPANY: PHOENIX CONTACT CANADA
LOCATION: Milton, ON
JOB TITLE: Digital Marketing Specialist
REPORTING TO: Marketing Manager – Industrial Components & Electronics
DESCRIPTION:
The Digital Marketing Specialist will support collaborative efforts in the distribution of integrated marketing services used to attract, engage, and convert customers online. This position will utilize social media, mobile apps, paid media, content marketing, SEO optimization, in addition to other emerging tools and platforms to develop and deploy cohesive messages for the market, such that all outbound messages have the look and feel that reinforces the company brand (Examples: YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google AdWords). This position will assist in the strategic planning and execution of multi-year messages across digital and online media to support the individual product and industry needs in the core functions of business including Industrial Components & Electronics, Industry Management & Automation, Device Connections and E-Mobility.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Perform digital landscape analysis, competitive audits, target audience analysis for brand Planning and new business opportunities.
Stay abreast of new media and digital trends
Strategy and execution of the digital marketing including SEO, Paid Search, Paid Social, Social Media and Content Marketing.
Ensure best practices are met across all digital tactics including paid search, SEO, display media, social media, and emails.
Assist in the development of advertising campaigns that most effectively utilize the resources to address the needs of the Product Marketing Managers (PMMs), Vertical Market Managers (VMMs), and Distribution in delivering a cohesive message.
Incorporate the strategic plan into messages placed on YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn while monitoring emerging social platforms and advising on Phoenix Contact's engagement within them.
Measuring and reporting on the performance of all digital marketing campaigns
Research and identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivate.
Ensure all content and digital assets meet all defined brand and legal standards, following established procedures and tools/workflows.
Coordinate and develop the electronic/digital messaging and management for the PMMs and with the VMMs while incorporating lead collection practices.
Develop targeted marketing programs to advance sales penetration at the small/medium customers.
Maintain effective communication channels and working relationships.
Provide digital strategy insights and recommendations based on analysis from analytical tools such as Google Analytics and Retargeted Marketing program in place.
Other duties as assigned.
Develops new and improved methods, products, procedures, or technologies.
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Marketing or Business Administration degree/diploma or equivalent related work experience.
Advanced technical knowledge of YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn.
Understanding and experience working with SEO and SEM
Proficient with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, HTML, HTML 5
Basic understanding of Industrial Control Applications is an advantage.
Experience in project and campaign management
Excellent communication, analytical & multitasking skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office: Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Bilingual
(English / French) an asset
ABOUT THE COMPANY
Phoenix Contact's roots are in Germany. Our headquarters are in Blomberg. Originally founded in Essen in 1923, we have grown over the years. With over 50 subsidiaries worldwide, we truly have Global reach.
Together with customers and partners, we design solutions for the future using trend-setting connection and automation technology. Wherever they are needed – for example, in transportation infrastructure, electromobility, for clean water, regenerative energies and intelligent supply networks, or energy-efficient machine building and systems manufacturing.
We face up to technological developments and the associated changes in society. With almost 100 years of experience in the field of machine building and automation, we are working on tomorrow's intelligent production today.
We appreciate your interest; however only candidates selected for interviews will be notified.
Phoenix Contact Ltd welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Director, Marketing - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Freddie
Freddie’s mission is an ambitious one: halving the spread of new HIV infections. HIV is on the rise, and over 50% of new HIV cases are in the LGBTQ2S+ community. Freddie has built a direct-to-consumer telemedicine offering to enable this community to access PrEP, an HIV prevention medication that reduces the risk of acquiring HIV by 99%. We launched in July 2020 and have quickly grown to become the largest HIV prevention service in Canada. And we’re just getting started.
We are looking for a
Director of Marketing
to lead all aspects of acquisition and lifecycle marketing. Our marketing team of four people has established a solid foundation of paid and organic acquisition to help us grow into Canada’s largest HIV prevention service. But we’re looking to you to push the boundaries and take us to the next level.
Reporting to our co-founder and Chief Commercial Officer, you will sit on our management team and work very closely with our founders, the rest of our management team, and across the entire organization (Clinical, Technology, Product, Operations, and Marketing).
Preference will be given to candidates based in Calgary or Toronto, but we are willing to consider exceptional remote candidates.
In this role, you will:
Lead a team of acquisition marketers - mentoring their development, cultivating their success, and fostering a culture of testing, innovation, experimentation and camaraderie as we continue to scale
Drive growth across several of our channels, both through hands-on channel management and through oversight of others’ activities, with a focus on meeting our goals for leads, revenue, return on ad spend (ROAS), and cost
Own and deliver on cross-team and cross-company initiatives
Diversify our marketing mix from paid (primarily Facebook and Google) to non-paid channels (SEO, content, organic social, events & partnerships)
As workload and challenges intensify, you will continue to build the team’s capabilities through interns, agencies, freelancers, and new team members as is appropriate
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams inside and outside Marketing to deliver a great customer experience throughout the whole journey
Delve deeply into our data to inform your and others’ programmatic choices, while working in tandem with our data team to build new collections and understandings
About you:
You have 8+ years of digital marketing experience in a mix of technology companies and/or agencies, including time leading a high-performing team
You have hands-on experience with multiple acquisition channels including optimization experience with A/B testing, creative testing, and landing page testing
You have a proven track record of driving aggressive growth in a high growth B2C business
You have the self-drive to execute to a very high bar plus the leadership skills to inspire others to deliver to the best of their capability
Balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly, and we need to do them well; Balancing those can be challenging, and this should be a strength
A "driver" personality - biased toward action, great collaborator and master disambiguator/simplifier - constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery
Grittiness. You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and address something hands-on, you persevere in times of headwinds and failures
Clear communicator. You are a clear and concise communicator with the ability to synthesize a lot of information quickly, highlight the key takeaways, and disseminate actionable insights
A passion for healthcare and the LGBTQ2S+ community
Successful candidates will be contacted for interviews. We look forward to your application!

Title: Content Marketing Writer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
CaseWare is a remote first company with opportunities in Canada, the United States and a few other countries across the globe. Since the global pandemic we have adapted an Agile Work Strategy, which aims to give people the option to work from home or work from a CaseWare office. Feel free to ask us questions about our approach at any point in the interview process.
The
Content Marketing Writer
plays a key role within the Brand, Content, and Communications function, part of the CaseWare Center of Excellence team. Working closely with the Content Marketing Manager and other COE teams centrally (Digital, Creative, and Product Marketing) and across all demand gen teams, the Content Marketing Writer will ensure that all content is created with the customer in mind, making the experience relevant and engaging, and ultimately resulting in conversion to achieve overall business objectives.
As a Content Marketing Writer at CaseWare. you'll create content and collaborate with industry, product, sales, and marketing teams to deliver the right messages to the right audience, at the right time in their journey. Your goal will be to create compelling, cleanly crafted, web-friendly content that works to communicate the value of CaseWare technologies to support multiple segments and different lines of business. You will be a part of the marketing team that is committed to delivering business objectives in creating meaningful content. This includes your passion as a storyteller with impeccable editorial skills to join our growing marketing team.
You'll be reporting into:
Tina Zappulla (Senior Global Brand Marketing Manager)
And working alongside:
Greg Enright (Content Marketing Manager)
What you will be doing:
Write high-quality content marketing materials to drive awareness of CaseWare’s vision, technologies and value, including blog posts, white papers, eBooks, customer success stories, emails and other materials as required.
Generate story ideas for blogs, white papers and other materials based on continual research of the accounting and auditing industries.
Copy-edit to brand and editorial style guidelines materials submitted by colleagues within the Marketing team and other internal departments, as well as from external partners and freelancers.
Build relationships with CaseWare subject matter experts and external auditing and accounting leaders for development of in-depth content materials.
Apply a rich knowledge of SEO techniques to optimize content for high search engine ranking; collaborate with Digital Marketing team to stay on top of SEO trends and continually refine our approach in this area.
Work with Creative team to develop high-impact graphics and ensure optimal layout of content materials
What you'll bring:
Minimum three years of experience working as a B2B Content Marketing Writer
Journalistic mindset with a nose for good stories that will appeal to our target audiences
Strong storytelling skills with proven ability to capture readers’ attention and hold it
Attention to detail with impeccable spelling and grammar skills
Experience in optimizing text with SEO keywords and phrases
Basic understanding and comfort level with web traffic metrics
Experience with WordPress or other Content Management software
Versatility and an ability to manage tight deadlines and multiple assignments
Knowledge of the finance world and digital transformation technologies (AI, Cloud, etc.) is preferred
Degree in Marketing, Journalism or relevant field
About CaseWare
With a head office in Toronto, CaseWare is one of Canada's original Fintech companies, having led the industry for over 30 years, with more than 500,000 users across 130 countries and available in 16 different languages.
While you might not have heard of us (yet) over 36,000 accounting and audit professionals list CaseWare as a skill on their LinkedIn profiles!
CaseWare's cutting-edge software products are meticulously designed for accounting firms, corporations and governments. Our teams are continually collaborating, innovating and building upon our existing suite of products. With a customer focused mindset we are building technology that is shaping what the future of audits, financial reporting and financial data analytics will look like.
With a recent strategic investment from Hg Capital in 2020, CaseWare is now in its next major growth phase as we double down on the people and products that have made CaseWare so successful to date.
One of CaseWare's core values is that we believe Our People Make Us Great and with that in mind, we're dedicated to building teams as diverse as our customers in an equitable and inclusive way. We welcome and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. Should you require accommodations or have any questions at any point during the application or interview process, please e-mail our People Operations team at careers@caseware.com.
Any candidates successful in obtaining an offer for a position will need to successfully complete a background check through
Certn.co
which typically includes an Identity Verification and Criminal Record Check. Executives and Senior Managers will undergo a Soft Credit Check as well.
#LI-remote

Title: Director Growth Marketing - Victoria, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Live Ops · Victoria, British Columbia
Apply for This Job
Department
Live Ops
Employment Type
Full Time
Minimum Experience
Experienced
Head of Growth
We are looking for a leader. A growth marketer who is an expert at paid user acquisition and marketing across a variety of channels. You know how to develop a strategy for the long-term and to deploy effectively against that plan to realize a vision and goals. You lead through influence and are up to date on market trends. Above all, you have the resilience and capacity to manage ambiguity, uncertainty and complexity.
As
Director of Growth Marketing
, you will be responsible for devising and executing a growth marketing strategy for Kano games.
You should:
Have a strong working knowledge of multiple user acquisition channels and be comfortable setting strategies for new user acquisition and re-engagement / retargeting.
Be comfortable allocating investments and resources across a portfolio of titles as well as buying efficiently across different channels with the ability to unlock new growth opportunities as they surface (Example: Emerging channels like TikTok, Reddit, etc).
Possess good negotiation skills and be able to build strong partnerships in the market.
Know the market leaders and your competition, and be able to perform effective marketplace SWOT analysis against them
In this role, you are expected to:
Strategize and execute across all user acquisition channels and diversify the buying mix through different channels. This includes, but is not limited to:
Setting strategy for new user acquisition and re-engagement/retargeting
Setting local market strategy and tactics for major geos and regions
Create long- and short-term scenarios and projections and clearly articulate to key stakeholders across the company
Perform marketplace SWOT and competitor analysis on a portfolio of titles
Exercise best judgement on allocating and moving investments and resources across a portfolio of titles, and mentor the team through the process
Understand the impact of App Store Optimization (ASO) on ranking and conversion metrics of the title and set a strategy to drive results
Build internal systems to improve processes and productivity, and make recommendations to support a growing organization
A major aspect of this role will be to build internal, cross functional partnerships to better collaborate against shared goals. This will include:
Partnering with the game teams to understand product roadmaps, features, design and economy, and how they translate into revenue
Working with marketing creatives to set creative strategy together and unlock growth for each title and marketplace
Working with data science to build reporting tools for growth marketing, ROAS modelling, channel audits, etc
Collaborating with finance to adjust the strategy and expectations of growth marketing through campaign results
Setting the vision for the growth marketing team and working with each individual to plan their professional growth
Experience we are looking for:
5+ years of experience of performance marketing for mobile games and a strong understanding of ROAS modelling, cohort analysis and digital marketing analytics
Strong analytical skills and evidence of making data driven decisions
Proven track record of working effectively with cross-functional teams and across all levels of the organization
Deep working knowledge of the mobile advertising space and its channels
Excellent negotiation and creative problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including ability to effectively present and share information across the organization
Experience working with P&Ls and defining financial key performance indicators
We’re a fast-growing company and your role will be constantly changing and evolving. We’re looking for team players eager to roll up their sleeves and try on a few hats without losing sight of our primary objective: growing our base of loyal customers. We will empower you with as much responsibility as you can handle and expect you to do whatever it takes to get the job done.
This position is open to remote applicants however, preference will be given to candidates willing to relocate to beautiful Victoria B.C.
About Kano
Bootstrapped in 2008, we have been a profitable and growing game studio for over a decade. With hits like Free Rider HD and Mob Wars LCN, and FUBAR: Just Give'r and we hope to contribute to the world by connecting people through play.
Locally owned and headquartered in downtown Victoria, BC, we believe in giving small teams of talented people challenging problems and getting out of their way. That’s why we look for the best and brightest to join our team; people who have talent, vision, and commitment.
Check out this article If you'd like to get some insight into our hiring process, our employee manual to understand how and why we do things the way we do, and this fun little video for an intro to the team!
2020 Great Place to Work - Best Workplaces in Canada - Less than 100 Employees
2019 Great Place to Work - British Columbia
2019 VIATEC Employer of the Year - Finalist
2018 VIATEC Company of the Year (11-49 Employees) - Winner
2018 VIATEC Employer of the Year - Finalist
2017 VIATEC Company of the Year (11-49 employees) - Finalist
2014 VIATEC Employer of the Year - Winner
A results-driven company with a compassionate culture
Health, dental and vision benefits
Uncapped profit share program
Opportunity to work on game projects that are enjoyed by millions of players worldwide!
Ability to make a difference. Have an idea? Talk directly with leadership about it instead of running through layers of bureaucracy
*Kano is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, age, disability, medical condition, religion, marital status or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law*

Title: Social Media Advertising Specialist - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
As a Facebook Ads Specialist, you will be responsible for creating high-performing paid campaigns using Facebook/Instagram Ads.
You will have the opportunity to work with multiple clients in a variety of industries. You will be involved in writing ads, testing, scaling, and optimizing them to deliver results.
Your responsibility will be to meet the client’s goals, create campaigns that align with their brand, and follow best practices for Facebook advertising.
The ideal candidate for this position is a Facebook expert who loves writing ad copy, managing campaigns, and creating strategies to help clients reach their marketing goals and ultimately grow their businesses.
Responsibilities
: Create New Strategies  * Create Facebook Ad strategies to achieve client goals  *  * Implement the strategy including campaign setups, copywriting, ad creation, audience creation, Facebook Pixel, and event setup Manage Facebook Ads Campaigns  * Manage Facebook and Instagram Ad strategies for your roster of clients  * Stay current with best practices, strategies, and industry standards related to Facebook and Instagram Ads  * Proactive monitoring and optimization for all client accounts  * Reach key performance targets  * Manage ad spend budgets  * Analyze and report on account performance, and communicate new opportunities  * Overall, your responsibility is to ensure your accounts are running smoothly and reaching your client’s goals Leadership  *
Qualifications
:  * 3+ years of Facebook Ads experience  * Facebook Ads Certification is preferred  * Experience managing a roster of clients and optimizing accounts to improve performance  * Experience creating strategies (including ad spend budgets), implementing and optimizing them to produce results  * Proven skills in ad copywriting  * Creative mindset  * Experience using Facebook Ads and Business Manager  * Strategic mindset with a demonstrated ability to analyze data  * Leadership & problem-solving skills
Bonus Skills & Experience
:  * Experience in the following areas is a bonus (Google Search & Display, YouTube, Pinterest Ads, LinkedIn Ads, TikTok Ads, and Google Analytics)  * Google Ads and Google Analytics certifications  * Experience with landing page development (WordPress and Unbounce).
Job Types: Part-time, Freelance
Pay: From $25.00 per hour
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
TikTik Ads: 1 year (preferred)
Google Ads: 2 years (preferred)
Facebook Advertising: 2 years (required)
Instagram Ads: 2 years (required)
Work remotely:
Yes

Title: Marketing Analyst - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
StackAdapt has experienced explosive growth since its founding in 2014 and the best is yet to come. We are the state-of-the-art, no minimums programmatic advertising platform where some of the most progressive work in machine learning meets cutting-edge user experience. Ad buyers can plan, execute, and analyze data-driven digital advertising campaigns across all devices, inventory sources and publishing partners. Our customers are strategic and exceptional digital marketers. Most of whom are independent, mid-market digital advertising and marketing agencies with some brands that have in-house advertising capabilities mixed in. Our obsessive focus on stellar results has earned StackAdapt the highest customer satisfaction scores in the DSP (demand side platform) industry, as demonstrated by our clear leadership position on G2.
We are looking for an innovative and versatile Marketing Analyst to join our expanding Marketing team. The right candidate will have a unique skill set based on developed expertise in reading, researching and writing. If you want to join an exceptional team supporting and driving hypergrowth in a well managed business in the martech/demand side platform market—then keep reading!
Our ideal candidate will have a balance of left brain and right brain abilities. We are looking for someone who is a voracious reader of public research, a researcher who can locate, purchase and consume relevant private research studies while also conducting proprietary analysis of the StackAdapt platform to produce unique insights. Insights that will form the foundation for content they will then write or help others write as we have a fantastic design team who will graphically bring the content to life.
What you'll be doing:
Conduct primary market research across the StackAdapt platform.
Conduct primary market research to deepen understanding of our target audience and their pain points.
Devise and evaluate methods for collecting data (surveys, questionnaires, opinion polls, focus groups, etc.).
Collect and consume relevant public research studies.
Research, recommend, purchase and consume relevant private research studies.
Be fully informed on market trends and future market predictions/forecasts.
Interpret data, formulate hypotheses, make recommendations.
Write or input others to write data-driven consultative content that advises our clients and prospects about future business opportunities or developing trends that they should consider when setting their strategies and advising their clients.
We'll be reaching out to applicants that have:
5+ years experience in marketing, research, consulting or related field.
Innate curiosity and search engine, web analytic and business research tools acumen.
Practical knowledge and experience collecting and analyzing data sets and using statistical analysis tools.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including long-form content development using supporting data as well as polished presentation materials.
Ability to advise senior management and clients regarding how to use final content to set business strategy.
StackAdapters Enjoy:
Highly competitive salary with RRSP Matching
3 weeks vacation + 3 personal care days + 1 volunteer day + birthdays off
Full benefits from League on day one of employment
Home office and Internet reimbursements
Coverage and support of personal development initiatives (conferences, courses, etc)
An awesome parental leave policy
A weekly $15 lunch credit via Ritual
A friendly, welcoming, and supportive culture
Our social and team events (virtually!)
About StackAdapt
StackAdapt is a self-serve programmatic advertising platform used by the most exceptional digital marketers. This state-of-the-art platform is where some of the most progressive work in machine learning meets cutting-edge user experience. Ad buyers plan, execute, and manage data-driven digital advertising campaigns across all devices, inventory, and publisher partners. StackAdapt is a Top 100 Software Product on G2, being the only DSP on the Best Software Products and Highest Satisfaction lists.
We've been recognized for our high performing campaign conversion rates, award-winning customer service, and innovation by numerous industry publications including:
Great Place to Work® named StackAdapt as one of Canada’s Best Workplaces for Start-ups in 2021
A leader in the DSP, Video and Cross-Channel Advertising Categories on G2
A Top Growing Company in Canada based on the Globe and Mail's 2020 Business Report
Named 23rd in Deloitte Canada’s Technology Fast 50™ program
Named in Deloitte Technology's Fast 500 in North America
StackAdapt is a diverse and inclusive team of collaborative, hardworking individuals trying to make a dent in the universe. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are happy to work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process. We welcome and encourage anyone and everyone to apply.

Title: Marketing Communications Executive Toronto, Canada Commercial - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Be a part of a revolutionary change
At Rothmans, Benson & Hedges Inc. (“RBH”), Philip Morris International’s subsidiary in Canada, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on smoke-free products with the power to improve the lives of millions of smokers in the country.
With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you’ll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions.
Your ‘day to day
As Marketing Communications Executive, you will be responsible for end-to-end development of engaging content that is on brand starting from concept through to final approvals and launch, including briefing phase and managing multiple rounds of feedback/revisions. You will assist in the planning and development of marketing strategies aimed at growing our portfolio of reduced risk products. Your core focus will be the development and implementation of on/offline brand marketing creative that guide adult consumers through all phases of the consumer journey.
You will be accountable for:
Acting as a brand expert, shaping brand positioning for the NCAs (non-combusted alternatives) portfolio in Canada and ensuring globally provided brand campaigns that have been adapted for the Canadian market are consistent across all consumer channels
Taking responsibility for content creation across multiple channels – predominantly digital (.com, email marketing, SMS, Social Media, Paid Media, and 3rd party digital media) with some content required for retail/in-store and print. This includes agency briefings, copywriting for print, web, and email communication, facilitating French translation, proofreading, and coordinating approvals and deployment
Monitoring the development of all local content to ensure the quality of the content meets brand guidelines while addressing business objectives
Developing creative assets in a fast-paced environment, ensuring deadlines are met while managing multiple stakeholders feedback and 3rd party creative agencies
Performing ongoing analysis of consumer data, creative results, and market trends aimed at gathering insights that can optimize marketing programs and communication
Ensuring compliance of all activities with company Principles and Practices, standards, and laws relating to these activities.
YOU ARE THE RIGHT PERSON FOR THIS JOB IF YOU HAVE
University degree and/or College Diploma, preferably in Marketing/Business
Minimum 5 years experience in Brand, Marketing, or Creative Agency
Ability to learn fast and work independently
Ability to manage multiple priorities
Bilingualism and copywriting skills are an asset
WHAT WE OFFER
We offer the opportunity to join an organization where you can grow in a wide range of business functions. You will have the chance to build your professional expertise, business understanding, and leadership capabilities in a collaborative, challenging environment where we will empower you to take risks, experiment and explore. Our company fosters excellence in execution and is comprised of dedicated people all working together to continue to grow our status as industry leaders. We offer our employees a competitive salary, an attractive compensation package, including flexible work schedules (where applicable), health and wellness programs, and attractive benefits options.
You will also be a part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
WHO WE ARE
We are Rothmans, Benson & Hedges Inc., Philip Morris International’s subsidiary in Canada -an International Fortune 500 Company. Today we are Canada's second largest tobacco company. In addition, RBH Inc. was awarded Top Employer for 2017, 2018 & 2019. We currently employ over 700 people throughout our six corporate and sales offices and our factory.
Our parent company PMI is one of the world’s leading international tobacco companies. In addition to the manufacture and sale of cigarettes, PMI is engaged in the development and commercialization of smoke-free products.
Click on the following link to learn more about what RBH believes: https://www.rbhinc.ca/home/what-we-believe
Rothmans, Benson & Hedges is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all current and prospective employees, as well as to promoting a culture of inclusion and respect for everyone. We celebrate the innovation that diversity creates in the work environment, and we recognize that each employee brings their own unique capabilities, experiences, and perspectives to the organization. It is this diversity that adds value to our teams, as well as to our stakeholders.
We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of race, ancestry, color, religion, sex, marital/family status (including pregnancy), national origin, sexual orientation, immigrant and newcomer status, gender identity/expression, age, citizenship, or disability. We consider qualified applicants who have passed the criminal background checks, consistent with legal requirements.
We strive to recognize and value diversity and equity, and to ensure the inclusion of underrepresented groups and the four designated groups: women, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. We value, respect, and equally support applicants from these groups.
We welcome and encourage applicants to reach their full potential with us. If you are unable to apply for a position online, or require any further accommodation during our recruitment process, please contact: AODA.RBH@rbhinc.ca.

Title: Performance Marketing Specialist, Paid Social - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Perpetua's mission is to give superpowers to anyone that sells online by building best-in-class ecommerce advertising products. At the moment, we help agencies, brands, and sellers win on Amazon, Instacart, Walmart, and Target by analyzing large amounts of data and using AI to develop smart optimization algorithms that drive transformational sales growth for our clients.
Now we’re looking for our own superhero digital marketer who can deliver this mission across our paid channels. The ideal candidate will marry deep technical knowledge of social ad platforms with an analytical drive to deliver on CPL and ROI goals. Join us and support our global expansion by helping us scale our performance marketing program.
So what will you do as a Performance Marketing Specialist?
Work with our Performance Marketing Lead to plan and execute brand and lead generation campaigns across performance marketing channels (paid social, online video, and affiliate)
Implement an Account-Based Marketing program, delivering cost effective leads against our target account lists.
Plan and implement A/B testing roadmap to continually improve spend efficiency and deliver improved CPL, and CAC.
Work closely with our Product Marketing and Content teams to build high-performing content funnels across all paid channels
Work with our data science team to deliver clear and effective reports of performance across acquisition and conversion metrics.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and developments in paid social, digital marketing, and B2B Marketing.
About you:
2-4 years of hands on experience planning and executing on paid social advertising platforms (Facebook, Linkedin, Twitter, Reddit, TikTok).
Proven results in delivering customer growth and strong CPL for a B2B or SaaS business.
Hands on experience with Youtube or Google Display Network.
Experience in Lead gen, B2B, or SaaS businesses.
High level of technical proficiency in Google Suite or Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and PowerPoint.
Highly analytical mindset
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Exceptional project management and organizational skills.
Positive attitude and ability to work well within a team environment.
Bonus points if:
Media, social, or digital agency experience.
Amazon advertising domain experience.
Experience with Salesforce and Pardot
Hands on programmatic advertising experience with The Trade Desk, DV360, or Amazon DSP.
About the Company (Benefits):
Full benefits plus a health spending account from day 1
Top-of-the-line technology to help you build your own workspace
Automatic enrollment in our employee revenue sharing plan
Flexible time off policy
Free catered office lunches from Toronto's best restaurants daily
Unlimited snacks and drinks in the office
At Perpetua, we are dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce with varied experiences, perspectives and opinions. We believe diversity helps our team perform better and enables us to build an outstanding product for our customers. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.
APPLY FOR THIS JOB
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Marketing & Digital Specialist - Burnaby, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
At BCIT, we champion diversity of experiences, ideas, cultures and perspectives, to foster a community in which equality and inclusivity are embedded in everything we do. We embrace endless innovation, ignited by imagination and creativity, to improve our approaches, opportunities and outcomes. We strive to achieve excellence in everything we do, to accomplish real, measurable results. We believe in the power of collaboration to amplify our efforts and begin every interaction with a foundation of respect for others’ expertise, insights and inherent worth. Our overall vision is to empower people, shape BC, and inspire global progress. If this resonates with you, come join our team as we continue to provide practical education for a complex world.
BCIT’s
Marketing & Communications
(MarComm)
department is seeking a
temporary, full-time Marketing and Digital Specialist
. Reporting to the Marketing Manager, this position is key to the realization of brand and communications goals set forth in BCIT’s Strategic Plan. This includes the development and execution of leading edge digital marketing strategies; analyzing and transforming data into optimizations that drive student recruitment; and providing marketing expertise to BCIT’s CRM implementation and solutions. The Specialist will drive solutions for data capture, customer journey mapping, and content strategy.
The Marketing and Digital Specialist works closely with a client portfolio in the BCIT community (including Schools and Administrative areas), developing and executing innovative marketing communications plans and products, pursuing recruitment targets, and leveraging CRM and data to create customized digital solutions. The Specialist will develop and contribute to advertising, collateral, event coordination, communications, digital and social media, customized lists, and other tactics.
Responsible for their assigned portfolio, the Specialist implements stellar account and project management practices, providing recommendations and solutions, driving projects from start to finish.
Duties & Responsibilities
DUTIES
&
RESPONSIBILITIES
:
Account Management and Client Service:
Manages a portfolio as a single-point of contact representing MarComm with assigned stakeholders, building proactive business partnerships to guide, develop, and execute innovative and strategic marketing and communications solutions to achieve BCIT’s objectives, building brand affinity and driving student recruitment.
Forms project teams with a variety of MarComm contributors. Manages project timelines and critical paths, timely and consistent communication with stakeholders, and reporting.
Works with multi-departmental groups in problem identification and resolution often with complex and confidential enrolment strategies and data, and makes recommendations on appropriate courses of action.
Digital Marketing:
Develops and project manages strategy and content for paid, earned, and owned digital marketing while ensuring synergy across tactics and campaigns.
Collaborates with agency and internal partners to develop strong, integrated campaigns and media strategies with the relevant analysis and business context to support decisions and drive brand objectives.
Responsible for internal and external email marketing. Creates, implements, and manages email marketing campaigns and lists, testing and reporting.
Applies best practices in CRM and customer analytics to segment our audiences and design customized campaigns, delivering optimized messages to the right audience at the right time across channels.
Shapes and implements an interim institute CRM program, leveraging available tools,
analyzing data, mapping communications and messaging along the customer lifecycle and recruitment funnel, building effective engagement strategies.
Shapes implementation of the enterprise CRM project’s application to marketing and communications initiatives and campaigns.
Provides recommendations and implementation of automations to ensure timely and relevant communications across platforms.
Optimizes online properties (e.g. campaign landing pages, social media channels) for customer experience and SEO.
Working closely with data sources across the institute and agencies, reports, analyzes results, and optimizes digital strategies and tactics.
Creates and executes social media strategy, aligning with the digital strategy, develops and curates content for Institute social media accounts.
Monitors digital trends and experiments with new digital tools.
Manages the student blogger and influencer program.
Marketing and Communications Products and Services:
Works with the assigned school contact(s) on the design and implementation of annual marketing and communications plan(s).
With the Manager, leads the development of innovative and strategic marketing and communications initiatives to meet objectives outlined in the school marketing plans. Implements tactics and reports marketing and campaign KPI scorecards to stakeholders.
Works with multiple contributors, taking the lead and project managing the development and execution of initiatives, including marketing campaigns, activations and events, partnership programs, communications and collateral.
Interviews internal and external stakeholders, conducts market research, and solicits feedback from subject matter experts.
Project manages, writes, and proofreads marketing and communications deliverables, aligning with brand and recruitment strategies, including: student recruitment publications, email communications, digital newsletters, social media posts, print and digital advertising, landing pages, etc.
Creates briefs and content outlines for marketing deliverables.
Provides support for producing video and photographic content, including strategy, talent coordination, on-set support, etc. May capture video and content for social media posts.
Drives the documentation process for marketing and communications planning with clients: developing detailed project plans, setting milestones, deliverables, agreed-upon processes and outcomes.
Managing Budgets:
Monitors and manages budgets relating to marketing and communications activities outlined in the school marketing plans.
Provides updates to stakeholders and MarComm on the status of their allocated marketing/campaign budget.
Qualifications
QUALIFICATIONS
:
Bachelor’s degree in a discipline such as business administration or marketing and communications, plus specialized training courses in an appropriate discipline.
Current specialized training and courses in digital marketing, analytics, CRM, social media, digital advertising, search engine optimization (SEO), and project management.
Two years general experience plus four years practical current experience in a similar position.
Proven ability to deliver creative and innovative marketing solutions, from ideation to activation in market.
Must have excellent oral, written, and presentation skills.
Proven ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships by exercising tact and diplomacy while maintaining the highest levels of customer service.
Must possess well-developed account and project management, organization, and problem-solving skills. Must be detailed oriented.
Working knowledge of CRM tools and customer databases, SEO, and Google Analytics.
Demonstrated know-how of effective social media use, engagement and management, including current experience planning and writing for social media platforms, developing content calendars, and reporting KPIs.
Experience with web Content Management Systems (CMS) such as WordPress.
Solid Microsoft Office skills plus working knowledge of email marketing platforms such as Industry Mailout, and Adobe Acrobat.
Exceptional understanding of CRM, acquisition strategies and tactics.
Working understanding of related digital disciplines such as User Experience, Content Strategy and Creation, Production, etc.
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure, meet tight deadlines and effectively handle changing priorities.
Additional Information
BENEFITS
OF
WORKING
AT
BCIT
:
Being a part of BC’s Top 100 Employers, and a member of the CCDI.
A generous Total Compensation package which includes extended health and dental benefits and a superb pension plan.
Access to Professional Development Funds and opportunities for career development.
Increase your knowledge with Tuition waivers for BCIT courses.
Enjoy discounted access to our fitness facilities (including classes like Yoga and Zumba).
Additional Wellness and Employee Assistance programs.

Pay Grade 10; $61,268 to $66,481 per annum

External hires are initially placed at the minimum of the salary range with progression to the maximum. Salary prorated based on percentage and term of appointment.

Title: Part-time Digital Communications Specialist - Paris, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview:
Parasource is Canada’s largest Christian resource products distributor. We have a key position open for someone who has the right skills and interests with a passion for Christian ministry and service to the church in Canada. Parasource is a fun and exciting place to work with an energetic and friendly staff.
We are seeking someone with web management, graphic design, and social media experience to work with our Marketing team.
The person in this role of Digital Communications Specialist will use their skills and experience to design printed marketing collateral (e.g. catalogues), help maintain up-to-date webstore content and help grow our webstore sales by using Social Media, Eblasts, and Print Media. Familiarity with Magento Enterprise is a plus or similar CMS software as well as Adobe Creative Suite.
Key Personal Traits:
· Well-organized
· Detail Oriented
· Multi-tasker
· Self-Motivated
· Systematic thinker
· Continually learning
· Good Communicator
· Collaborative
· Personable
Main Position Responsibilities:
· Design/create webstore graphics and maintain product content integrity & relevant promotional support.
· Work with marketing team to continually improve the webstore.
· Design printed pieces to promote products through wholesale and direct channels.
· Work with Marketing team to coordinate Social Media promotions.
· Collaborate with Sales and Marketing Team to actively participate in our commitment to service and help our customers.
Position Requirements:
Formal Education: Diploma in Marketing, Communications, Web Commerce, or Graphic Design
Professional Experience: Experience with E-commerce website CMS and graphic design knowledge required. Minimum 2 years+ experience preferable.
Technical Knowledge: Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud. Familiarity with Magento or similar CMS software and Social Media Marketing.
Special Qualification: Interest in, knowledge of, and passion for, both the church & the Christian marketplace. Please reference same in cover letter or resume.
Availability: Regular part-time hours between 8AM and 430PM Monday to Friday, Approximately 24 hours/week, based on individual availability. Potential for increasing hours over time. Work is based out of our Paris, ON office with potential to work from home occasionally. You should live within a commutable distance of Paris, ON.
Part-time hours: 24 per week
Job Type: Part-time
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Title: Digital Marketing Manager - Burnaby, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
An exciting and challenging position exists as the Digital Marketing Manager at Vega. Reporting to the Senior Brand & Communications Manager, this role will lead all Digital Media and oversee a Social Media Specialist that will help drive brand awareness, promote brand loyalty and ultimately drive sales in key channels like our DTC site and Amazon. In this role, you will be responsible for working with the Senior Brand & Communications Manager to develop and launch marketing campaigns across several digital platforms like Facebook, Instagram and YouTube. You will work cross functionally with the in-house creative team to create relevant content, recommend the appropriate channel strategy based on the business objectives and oversee digital media buying via our external agency.
Key Responsibilities
Development of Vega’s annual digital media communications plan (owned social channels and paid media)
Management of our external Media Buying agency – including budgeting, relationship management, KPI setting and reviews
Working in tandem with the Brand team to ensure digital media communications plans align to overall business strategy and priorities
Working collaboratively with our internal Creative Agency and eCommerce team on the development of all assets and content
Working with our internal DTC/eComm teams on ensuring the proper support on sales driving initiatives
Conducting post-campaign reviews and providing insight on optimizations for future work
Continual optimization of our always-on media, assessing what is working and trialing new channels/platforms
Conduct online research with key partners to garner insights on what creative is helping us to achieve brand goals, then optimizing future campaigns based on learnings
Oversee the Social Media Specialist, providing leadership and guidance
Budget management and allocation
Skills and Qualifications
Undergraduate degree/Diploma in Digital Media, Marketing or Communications preferred
3+ years of progressive experience in the Digital Marketing space (agency or client side) and/or Communications
Experience developing & executing digital advertising campaign including online video, paid social, owned social, paid search, performance marketing
Experience with creative evaluation and optimization, as well as deep understanding of creative best practices across platforms
Minimum 1-2 years of people management experience
Experience managing budgets and analyzing campaign performance
Strong communications & presentation skills to get buy in on campaign plans and to present post-campaign reviews
Current experience and full understanding of media trends, tools, strategies
Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills. A natural leader who can bring together teams under a common goal.
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects, stakeholders and timelines
Ability to adapt and pivot to changing needs of the business
VEGA “Must Haves”
You have an unrelenting desire to achieve
The outdoors isn’t just the place between your car and house
You have a sense of humor and passion for health and wellness
You love to have fun, but take your responsibilities seriously
You live the Vega brand
Benefits of Working for Vega
Competitive compensation plan
Annual performance bonus
Vega product to try so that you can perform at your best and promote the Vegatopian lifestyle
Extended Health Plan
Employee assistance program (EAP)
Summer hours (June to September)
Group RSP Matching program
Flexible time off
Referral bonus program incentive
Fitness Subsidy
Education fund
Paid volunteer days
Virtual fitness classes
Access to Vega’s Online Learning Library
Dogs in the office (virtually on video calls) – Woof!
Let Your Journey Begin!
If you smiled and are motivated by this posting, we want to hear from you. Submit your resume to careers@myvega.com with “Digital Marketing Manager” on the subject line and let us know why you’d like to be Vega’s next Product Developer. Let your journey begin!
Vega is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We offer reasonable accommodations to candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. We thank all candidates for their time and interest in working at Vega, however, only candidates under consideration for opportunities with Vega will be contacted to participate further in this process. If you are contacted and you require any accommodation in the recruitment process due to a disability, please indicate this and we will work with you to meet your reasonable accessibility needs.
Job Type: Permanent

Title: Content Creator/Digital Marketing Associate - Kitchener, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Heffner Motors is a leading automotive retailer in the Waterloo Region. Since 1960 we have been known for honesty, integrity and outstanding service to our customers. We value our employees as well as our customers. Our full service facility covering over 21 acres, allows us to serve all of our customer’s automotive needs – a true one-stop automotive centre. A career in the retail automotive industry will allow you to grow and provide exemplary service to customers. We are always looking for employees who are customer-service oriented, work well in a team environment and are looking for a fast-paced environment to flourish in.
CONTENT CREATOR/DIGITAL MARKETING ASSOCIATE – FULL TIME
We’re looking for a Content Creator/Digital Marketing Associate to grow our followers, engage and retain them, and help convert them into leads, customers, and active fans and promoters of our company. You should have command of best practices and trends in social media marketing, enjoy being creative, and understand how to both build and convert a digital audience.
Responsibilities:
Build and manage the company’s social media profiles and presence, including Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and potentially additional channels (Snapchat, Tik Tok, etc.).
Digital Content Creation appropriate for specific networks to both spread our brand and our content and links. Including blogs, videos, and website content
Listen and engage in relevant social discussion about our company, competitors, and/or industry, both from existing customers and leads and from brand new audiences that don’t yet know us.
Create, manage and analyze Google Adword campaigns
Create Google keyword campaigns as needed
Work alongside other marketers and content producers to help distribute content that educates and entertains our audience.
Design, write and distribute targeted emails to our guests
In addition to a very competitive wage structure, we offer
a comprehensive Health & Benefit plan,
access to an onsite company gym,
an excellent company profit sharing program
Heffner Motors is an equal opportunity employer and is able to accommodate applicants with disabilities in the recruitment process

Title: Brand Marketing Lead - British Columbia - Indeed.com
Description:
The
Brand Marketing Lead
plays an essential role in
growing talent
in our business through collaboration and sharing best practices with the Brand Marketing team. You know how to
be curious
about their opportunities and how to
be real
with feedback and support.
The Brand Marketing Lead creates engaging, consumer-insight driven marketing initiatives to increase brand discovery, traffic and brand consideration leading to sales. As the lead business brief creator for a POD, you collaborate with creative and consumer insight peers to create omnichannel, brand and marketing department strategies for use across multiple digital channels and in-store.
As a growing business, Lush needs people that can
adapt and evolve
to the needs of our business, analyse and respond to your learner's needs. Our Lush staff
live with purpose
, finding their personal value connection with the values of our business, bringing their work and life paths into one holistic journey. #mylushlife
Reporting to the
Senior Brand Marketing Manager
, the
Brand Marketing Lead
undertakes the following
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Support the Senior Brand Marketing Manager and Brand Director by creating short, mid and long-term marketing strategies/briefs to support brand marketing goals, sales targets and content calendar for a designated POD or projects
Use both consumer and marketing insights to develop relevant strategic approaches built on SMART planning that identifies marketing goals and bench-marked social metrics, sales targets, overall market opportunities and consumer insights
Manage POD specific, strategic development of seasonal and monthly product campaigns and new product launches including collaborating with other PODs for department-wide launches
Ensure POD marketing initiatives are successful, metrics-driven, goal-oriented and true to the Lush brand
Develop brand briefs that collaborate with and consider the business needs of retail/in-store and visual merchandising, digital (website, e-comm, app, email)
Ensure the timely execution of briefs with the collaboration of creative services and project managers
Identify distinct omni-channel opportunities and partnerships at key moments to engage, acquire and retain customers
Work closely and collaborate with creative, PR/events, social media/digital partners to ensure messaging follows brief strategies and is delivered with excellence, based on the business and brand priorities
Provide insightful, objective and relevant feedback to creative teams to deliver on brand business strategy briefs and targets
Continually raise the bar on development of compelling, data-driven storytelling with a customer focus
Develop and present campaign and all-year-round briefs to relevant stakeholders and develop various presentations for internal and external communication as needed
Analyze results of programs, draw conclusions and develop actionable recommendations
Accountable for measuring results and exploring ways to improve performance
Work closely with both consumer insights and social media lead to track and understand campaign impact on consumer sentiment and brand health to build successful strategies
Prepare and present campaign and all-year-round reporting and analytics on all marketing activity tracking the effects of marketing strategies to extract key insights for future campaign development and go-to-market strategies complete with formal proposals and recommendations on tactics
Track POD monthly and annual budget including forecasting, PO creation, invoice processing and monthly reconciliation and identifying variances between actual and budgeted financials each month with the Senior Brand Marketing Manager and Brand Director.
You bring the following
QUALIFICATIONS:
6 - 7 years of experience in one or more of the following: marketing, public relations or social media.
3+ years' experience in successfully building marketing strategies
Success in building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs
General management/strategic mindset and brand management training at a consumer-packaged goods company
Ability to operate at both a strategic and execution level
Experience creating marketing briefs and working with Creative teams
Experience presenting metrics and progress to goal to senior leadership
Strong oral and written communication skills with proven ability to influence
Strategic understanding of brand, digital and social media marketing in addition to appropriate metrics of success
Proven success in developing social/digital marketing approaches
Fluency in digital/social, paid and organic marketing and ability to identify and proactively understand emerging channels
Tenacity for trying new types of story-telling and taking creative risks
Ability to move easily between generating big, creative ideas and driving ongoing process improvement
Proven ability to problem solve, think critically and in an integrated manner, while presenting outside- the-box ideas
Strong ability to analyze results of programs, draw conclusions and develop actionable recommendations
Ability to interpret data, draft recaps/presentations, and make actionable recommendations
Strong problem solving and analytical skills, including comfort with data
Proven project management and planning skills, with ability to manage, prioritize, multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
Experience using data and metrics to measure impact and determine improvements
Preferred:
Bachelor's degree (or higher) in related field (communications, marketing, journalism or public relations) or equivalent
Direct experience working within cosmetics/beauty industry
Thriving with a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our staff and committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Title: Email Marketing Specialist - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Hi there, we're Fancii & Co! We're seeking a full-time talented digital marketing expert/copywriter who will play an integral role in our marketing and sales efforts.
Before we get into the role, a little bit about us -
Fancii is a beauty tool brand led by women who live by their own beauty standards. We are here to be a new voice in the beauty industry that says come as you damn well please—beauty mishaps and all. We don’t believe age needs defying and we haven’t discovered the gene for poreless skin. Our mission is to help people look good and feel amazing, one beauty tool at a time.
Now here's where you come in! We're currently on the search for a marketing expert specialized in email marketing and copywriting, who can share our mission with the world! You must create clear, compelling sales-driven copy for our products across various online/offline channels while also understanding the strategy and concept behind your work. Previous experience in email marketing and copywriting is a must, minimum 2 years. The majority of this role will involve working closely with our retail team to create product listings that SELL. You will also need to work with Klaviyo, our email marketing software to create sales-driven emails to our subscribers. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a collaborative environment and using data to make proper marketing decisions.
We are looking for:
Someone who can research and write out of the box
Someone who doesn't need much supervision and who understands that selling online is all about testing, so it may need several versions of the same copy.
Someone who has a
passion for sales, marketing, and copywriting
and the desire to improve, learn and grow these skills each day (Eg: Readings books on how to become an expert copywriter, editing and testing copy until it performs the very best, etc )
Someone who is creative, hard-working, and has a go-get-em’ personality!
Job Responsibilities:
Write compelling and succinct copy with attention to grammar and brand guidelines for email, social media, blogs, etc.
Basic designing of emails in Klaviyo
Scheduling email campaigns
Segmentation and email flows
Analyze data and results from email campaigns
Create reporting to present to the marketing team
Optimize for future campaigns based on previous findings
Qualifications & Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism or a related field
Minimum 3 years experience in digital marketing with a focus on copywriting
Minimum 3 years experience in email marketing, preferably using Klaviyo
Strong prioritization, organization, and project management skills
Attention to details
How to Apply
Include your cover letter and resume
Tell us 3 interesting things about you and what motivates you to succeed?
Job Types: Full-time, Temporary, Permanent
Salary: $53,917.00-$85,800.00 per year
Benefits:
Casual dress
Dental care
Extended health care
Flexible schedule
Vision care
Work from home
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

From scale of 1 to 10, what's your experience with email segmentation?
From scale of 1 to 10, what's your experience with email flows?
Experience:
Klaviyo: 1 year (required)
email marketing: 3 years (preferred)
graphic design: 1 year (preferred)
digital marketing: 3 years (preferred)
